sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A True narrative of the proceedings at the sessions-house in the Old-Bayley, on the 3 and 4 days of July, 1678 containing the tryals of several persons for murder, many for robberies : one young fellow found guilty of a rape, also the tryal of a female-Muggleton for blasphemy, and for all the other malefactors that for any considerable crimes were there arraigned : with the number of those that are condemn'd, burn'd in the hand, and to be whipt, &c. England and Wales. Court of Quarter Sessions of the Peace (London)
[1], 7 p.
Printed for D.M., London : 1678.
"With allowance." Imperfect: pages faded with print show-through. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
=======
A True narrative of the proceedings at the sessions-house in the Old-Bayley, on the 3 and 4 days of July, 1678 containing the tryals of several persons for murder, many for robberies : one young fellow found guilty of a rape, also the tryal of a female-Muggleton for blasphemy, and for all the other malefactors that for any considerable crimes were there arraigned : with the number of those that are condemn'd, burn'd in the hand, and to be whipt, &c. England and Wales. Court of Quarter Sessions of the Peace (London)
[1], 7 p.
Printed for D.M., London : 1678.
"With allowance." Imperfect: pages faded with print show-through. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
D.M.
